$comment: MIND harmonised 2025-10 — static metadata describing a tracked hand, including provenance, structure, and coordinate conventions.
title: handMeta
description: Static metadata describing a tracked hand, including device and tracking system provenance, joint and bone hierarchy, and coordinate conventions. Enables interoperability across hand-tracking SDKs and hardware platforms.

region.description: Fixed region identifier for this metadata type.

side.description: Anatomical side of the hand being tracked.

trackingSystem.description: Name of the hand-tracking software framework or SDK (e.g., 'OpenXR', 'Ultraleap', 'ARKit', 'Manus Core', 'Custom').

trackingProfile.description: Specific joint definition or system profile used by the tracking system (e.g., 'XR_EXT_hand_tracking', 'UnityXRHands').

trackingVersion.description: Version or API level of the tracking system.

deviceVendor.description: Manufacturer or vendor of the hand-tracking hardware (e.g., 'Meta', 'Varjo', 'Ultraleap', 'Apple').

deviceModel.description: Specific model name or identifier for the device used to capture hand-tracking data.

sourceURI.description: Optional URI or identifier linking to detailed device calibration or configuration information.

skeleton.description: Optional reference to a detailed skeleton metadata object defining this hand’s joint and bone topology.

joints.description: List of all joint metadata objects for this hand, following the chosen tracking standard (e.g., OpenXR, UnityXRHands).

bones.description: List of all bone metadata objects connecting hand joints.

jointCount.description: Number of joints defined in this hand skeleton (e.g., 26 for a full OpenXR hand).

coordinateSystem.description: Coordinate system convention for spatial data.

unit.description: Measurement unit for positional data. Always metres in the MIND standard.

metadata.description: Optional extended metadata such as calibration parameters, offsets, or confidence scores.

extensions.description: Custom extension fields for future compatibility.
